intro: Centropogon warscewiczii var. vimineus, commonly known as the slender centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and attract pollinators like hummingbirds and bees. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
